adjective.description: (of a person or their judgment) not influenced by personal feelings or opinions in considering and representing facts.
examples: historians try to be objective and impartial

adjective.description: Relating to or denoting a case of nouns and pronouns used as the object of a transitive verb or a preposition.

noun.description: A thing aimed at or sought; a goal.
examples: the system has achieved its objective

noun.description: The lens in a telescope or microscope nearest to the object observed.

origin: Early 17th century: from medieval Latin objectivus, from objectum (see object).
